title: Jio and Star to operate as unified entity from India-England series - Cricbuzz
summary:
Jio and Star to Operate as Unified Entity from India-England Series

Published on: Mon, Dec 23, 2024, 05:16 PM | Source: Cricbuzz

With the completion of the mega-merger between Jio and Star, the two sports broadcasting giants will start operating as a unified entity during the England tour of India.

  • The merger allows for cross-promotion of properties across platforms.
  • The England series will be broadcast live on Star Sports and Disney+ Hotstar, along with original platforms like JioCinema.
  • The transaction of the joint venture was worth INR 70.352 crore (USD 8.5 billion).
  • Reliance Industries invested Rs 11,500 crore (1.4 billion) into the venture.
  • Star Sports remains a leading sports channel in India but has faced competition from rivals like Sports18 and JioCinema.
“The merger of the media and JioCinema businesses of Viacom18 into Star India Private Limited (SIPL) has become effective.” - Reliance Industries Limited

This integration marks a new era in sports broadcasting in India, potentially reshaping how cricket and other sports are presented to the audience.
newTitle: Jio and Star to Operate as Unified Entity from India-England Series

title: Chelsea loanee Raheem Sterling ruled out ‘for a while’ at Arsenal with knee injury - We Ain't Got No History
Tanush Kotian to join India's Test squad as Ashwin's replacement - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Tanush Kotian to Join India's Test Squad as Ashwin's Replacement

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Tanush Kotian, a talented offspin-bowling allrounder from Mumbai, has been chosen to replace R Ashwin in India's Test squad for the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests.

  • Kotian will fly to Melbourne following Ashwin's retirement after the third Test.
  • He is in Ahmedabad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy as part of the Mumbai squad.
  • The fourth Test starts on Thursday, with the series being tied 1-1.
  • Kotian has a first-class record of 101 wickets and 1525 runs in 33 matches.
  • He was instrumental in Mumbai's Ranji Trophy success, earning the Player-of-the-Tournament award.
  • Kotian is alongside Manav Suthar in being viewed as a future prospect for the India Test setup.
“Kotian was the only player to complete the season double of 500 runs and 25 wickets.”

This inclusion highlights Kotian's rising profile and adds depth to India's spinning options as they navigate the crucial Test matches ahead.
newTitle: Tanush Kotian to Join India's Test Squad as Ashwin's Replacement

title: Melbourne Pitch To Help Jasprit Bumrah And Co. In Boxing Day Test vs Australia? Curator Says: "As Mu.. - NDTV Sports
Tanush Kotian added to India's squad for the last two Tests against Australia - The Times of India
summary:
Tanush Kotian added to India's squad for the last two Tests against Australia

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: Times of India

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has announced the addition of all-rounder Tanush Kotian to the Indian cricket squad for the fourth and fifth Tests of the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • Kotian, an off-spinner from Mumbai, has been rewarded for his impressive performances in domestic cricket.
  • He has taken 101 wickets in 33 first-class matches at an average of 25.70, including three five-wicket hauls.
  • Kotian has scored two centuries and 13 half-centuries.
  • The 24-year-old's standout performances in the 2023-24 Ranji Trophy season helped Mumbai achieve victory.
  • He was named Player of the Tournament, scoring 502 runs at an average of 41.83 and taking 29 wickets at an average of 16.96.
  • Kotian replaces R Ashwin, who announced his retirement after the third Test.
Kotian's addition provides the Indian team with an additional spin-bowling option and batting depth as they aim to clinch the series against the formidable Australian side.

The series is currently tied at 1-1 after three Tests, making these upcoming matches crucial for both teams.
newTitle: Tanush Kotian added to India's squad for the last two Tests against Australia

title: "Wanted To Leave Things Behind As...": Ravichandran Ashwin Ends Silence On Abruptly Retiring Mid-Ser.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Wanted To Leave Things Behind As...: Ravichandran Ashwin Ends Silence On Abruptly Retiring Mid-Series In Australia

Publication Date: September 22, 2024 Source: NDTV

Indian cricket star Ravichandran Ashwin surprised fans by announcing his retirement from international cricket after the third Test against Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Ashwin, the highest wicket-taker among active bowlers, retired with two Tests remaining in the series.
  • His decision to retire was questioned by former players like Sunil Gavaskar.
  • In an interview, Ashwin expressed his need to not hold onto things and emphasized his belief in leaving without celebration or attention.
  • He reflected on his love for the game and his journey, highlighting that he has no regrets regarding his career.
“I’ve got no regrets because I’ve had to do it the hard way, but it has left me with the idea that the game has been my calling.” - Ravichandran Ashwin

Ashwin's retirement marks the end of a significant chapter in Indian cricket, affecting fans and the team as they adapt to his absence.
newTitle: Ravichandran Ashwin Retires Mid-Series: Here's Why

Vinod Kambli diagnosed with 'clots in brain' in worrying health update; hospital provides life-long free treatment - Hindustan Times
summary:
Vinod Kambli Diagnosed with Brain Clots; Hospital Offers Free Treatment

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Vinod Kambli, former Indian cricketer, has been diagnosed with clots in his brain after being admitted to the hospital following a health decline over the weekend. The hospital has committed to providing him with lifelong free treatment.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital due to urinary infection and cramps.
  • Doctors found clots in his brain after conducting examinations.
  • The hospital's medical in-charge announced lifelong free treatment for Kambli.
  • Kambli suffered a previous collapse due to health issues about a month ago.
  • Concerns from cricket legends like Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar regarding his health were noted.
"I was suffering from a urine problem... My head started spinning; I collapsed and fell down." - Vinod Kambli

Kambli's health situation is being closely monitored, and he is receiving additional medical examinations as needed.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli Diagnosed with Brain Clots; Hospital Offers Free Treatment

India dealt blow as pacer is ruled out for remainder of Australia series - ICC Cricket
summary:
India dealt blow as pacer Shami is ruled out for remainder of Australia series

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Indian pacer Mohammed Shami has been ruled out for the rest of the Test series against Australia due to a recurring heel injury.

  • Shami has been nursing a right heel injury since the 2023 Men’s Cricket World Cup.
  • He returned to competitive cricket in the Ranji Trophy and has participated in T20 games for West Bengal.
  • Indian captain Rohit Sharma emphasized the importance of not risking players who are not fully fit.
  • Shami has taken 31 wickets in 8 Tests played in Australia.
  • Harshit Rana has been included in the Test squad in Shami's absence.
“There is no way we want to take that chance – unless we are not 100%, 200% sure, we're not going to take any risk.” - Rohit Sharma

India faces challenges in their bowling lineup without Shami, who has been pivotal in past tours to Australia.
newTitle: India dealt blow as pacer Shami is ruled out for remainder of Australia series

'Don't cry because its over': Heartfelt sentiments from R Ashwin with the Indian flag as the backdrop - The Times of India
summary:
'Don't cry because its over': Heartfelt sentiments from R Ashwin with the Indian flag as the backdrop

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

India's premier off-spinner, R Ashwin, announced his retirement from international cricket while reflecting on his journey, expressing gratitude and fond memories.

  • Ashwin retired mid-series against Australia, marking the end of a storied international career.
  • He is India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, with 537 wickets.
  • The farewell photo featured a smiling Ashwin with the Indian national flag in the background.
  • Despite his retirement, he affirmed he still has cricket left in him.
  • Ashwin's career spanned various formats, amassing significant wicket totals in ODIs and T20Is as well.
“Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.”

R Ashwin's retirement emphasizes the end of an era for Indian cricket, celebrated for his skill, intellect, and contributions to the game.
newTitle: 'Don't cry because its over': Heartfelt sentiments from R Ashwin with the Indian flag as the backdrop

PV Sindhu marries Venkat Datta at Udaipur in a private ceremony - The Indian Express
summary:
PV Sindhu Marries Venkat Datta in Private Ceremony

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu embarked on a new journey in life as she tied the knot with entrepreneur Venkata Datta Sai in a private ceremony.

  • Wedding took place in Udaipur with close family and friends.
  • The celebrations included a Sangeet ceremony followed by traditional rituals.
  • Union Minister of Culture and Tourism shared the first photograph of the wedding on social media.
  • Sindhu recently ended a title drought with her win at the Syed Modi International.
  • Prominent guests expected at the reception include celebrities like Sachin Tendulkar and Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
“Pleased to have attended the wedding ceremony of our Badminton Champion Olympian PV Sindhu with Venkatta Datta Sai in Udaipur last evening and conveyed my wishes & blessings to the couple for their new life ahead,” Gajendra Singh Shekhawat tweeted.

This wedding marks a new chapter in Sindhu's life, showcasing not only her personal achievements but also her status as a celebrated athlete in India.
newTitle: PV Sindhu Marries Venkat Datta in Private Ceremony

title: "Clots In Brain": On Vinod Kambli's Urgent Hospitalisation, Doctor Gives Worrying Update - NDTV Sports
"Clots In Brain": On Vinod Kambli's Urgent Hospitalisation, Doctor Gives Worrying Details - NDTV Sports
summary:
Vinod Kambli Hospitalized Due to Brain Clots: Doctor Provides Update

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Vinod Kambli, the former India cricketer, has been hospitalized with brain clots following initial complaints of a urinary infection. Doctors have reported that his condition remains critical but stable.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital in Thane after experiencing urinary issues and cramps.
  • Medical examinations revealed clots in his brain; ongoing monitoring and further tests are scheduled.
  • Dr. Vivek Trivedi stated that Kambli's health is being closely observed.
  • Life-long free treatment has been pledged by the hospital in-charge, S Singh.
  • Kambli's recent health struggles have gained public attention, particularly due to viral videos showing his condition.
Kambli said, "I am better now. My wife takes care of me a lot... My son picked me up and brought me back to my feet."

The situation remains serious as doctors continue to monitor Kambli's health, and further updates are anticipated.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli Hospitalized Due to Brain Clots: Doctor Provides Update

summary:
Australian Reporter Confronts Virat Kohli Over Airport Incident

Publication Date: October 18, 2023 | Source: Times of India

The article discusses an incident where Australian reporter confronted Indian cricketer Virat Kohli after he allegedly bullied a female journalist at an airport, prompting a strong reaction from the media community.

  • Australian reporter speaks out against Virat Kohli's behavior.
  • The incident occurred at an airport when Kohli confronted a female journalist.
  • The reporter criticized Kohli, labeling him as a bully.
  • This incident has generated significant media attention and discussion on social media.
"You're nothing but a bully, Virat," remarked the reporter, highlighting the negative impact of Kohli's actions.

This incident has sparked a broader conversation about the treatment of journalists, particularly women, in the sporting world and the responsibilities of public figures.

"Not Able To Do The Job": Cheteshwar Pujara's Unfiltered Dig At India Duo Ahead of Boxing Day Test - NDTV Sports
summary:
Not Able To Do The Job: Cheteshwar Pujara's Unfiltered Dig At India Duo Ahead of Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Cheteshwar Pujara expresses concerns over the Indian bowling attack's ability to take 20 wickets in Tests ahead of the critical Boxing Day Test against Australia, emphasizing the team's need for improvement in their bowling depth and top-order batting performance.

  • Pujara questions the current effectiveness of India’s bowling attack, particularly their fourth and fifth bowlers.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1, with crucial matches in Melbourne and Sydney ahead.
  • Concerns about the top-order batting alongside the bowling dilemma, with specific reference to Mitchell Starc's outstanding performance.
  • Pujara criticizes the lack of support for Jasprit Bumrah and the need for a stronger team composition.
Pujara stated, "To win a Test match, you have to take 20 wickets, and the ability to take 20 wickets is not that good."

Overall, Pujara emphasizes the need for strategic adjustments in both bowling and batting if India aims to secure victory in the remaining Test matches.
newTitle: Cheteshwar Pujara Critiques Indian Bowling Ahead of Boxing Day Test

title: Kuldeep Yadav doubtful for Champions Trophy, inclusion for England series under threat - CricTracker
summary:
Kuldeep Yadav Doubtful for Champions Trophy as Recovery Continues

Date: October 2023

Source: CricTracker

The Indian cricket team is preparing for the Champions Trophy 2025 but faces uncertainty with star spinner Kuldeep Yadav's upcoming participation due to a groin injury.

  • India is set to participate in the Champions Trophy in February 2025, hosted by UAE and Pakistan.
  • Kuldeep Yadav is recovering from a groin injury and recent surgery, limiting his chances for selection in upcoming matches against England.
  • His coach remains hopeful of his early return to training and potential inclusion in the Champions Trophy.
“Kuldeep is yet to start bowling... it’s not impossible but tough (for Kuldeep to return) as just over a month remains for those games to begin.”

The situation regarding Kuldeep's fitness is critical as the tournament approaches, with his coach optimistic about his chances of recovery in time for the Champions Trophy.
newTitle: Kuldeep Yadav Doubtful for Champions Trophy as Recovery Continues

title: Renegades edge Scorchers in low-scoring thriller - Cricbuzz
summary:
Renegades edge Scorchers in low-scoring thriller

Date: Mon, Dec 23, 2024

Source: Cricbuzz

The Melbourne Renegades clinched a two-wicket victory over the Perth Scorchers, marking their first win against them since December 2020. Despite a valiant effort from Cooper Connolly, who scored 66 runs, the Scorchers couldn't defend their total of 143.

  • Scorchers limited to 143/8 in 20 overs.
  • Cooper Connolly was the standout performer for Scorchers with 66 runs.
  • Renegades chased down the target, finishing at 144/8 in 19 overs.
  • Tom Rogers took 3 wickets for the Renegades with figures of 3-22.
  • This victory ends a six-match losing streak against the Scorchers.
“It was a tense finish, but we were glad to secure the win.”

This match showcased the competitive spirit of the BBL, with both teams facing challenges and creating a gripping low-scoring contest.
newTitle: Renegades Secure Thrilling Win Over Scorchers in BBL 2024-25

title: Tanush Kotian to join India squad; Shami deemed unfit - Cricbuzz
summary:
Tanush Kotian Joins India Squad as Shami Remains Unfit

Publication Date: Mon, Dec 23, 2024, 01:04 PM

Source: Cricbuzz

Tanush Kotian, a promising offspinning all-rounder from Mumbai, is set to join India’s squad for the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy after Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement announcement.

  • Kotian is expected to arrive in Melbourne ahead of the third Test.
  • He has been a key player in Mumbai's cricket scenes, especially in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • Statistics: Kotian has played 33 first-class games, scoring 1525 runs and taking 101 wickets.
  • Shami has been ruled unfit to play due to a knee issue, hampering his return to international cricket.
  • Shami's progress will be closely monitored by the BCCI Medical Team for future matches.
“Shami experienced swelling in his left knee due to bowling workload, indicating he is not ready for selection.”

This move represents a significant shift in the team as they prepare for the high-stakes matches ahead.
newTitle: Tanush Kotian Joins India Squad as Shami Remains Unfit

Breaking: Arjun Erigaisi gets US visa, to fly tonight for World Rapid and Blitz - The Indian Express
summary:
Arjun Erigaisi Secures US Visa for World Rapid and Blitz Championship

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 - Source: The Indian Express

After a nerve-wracking wait over the past week, Arjun Erigaisi has received his US visa to compete at the World Rapid and Blitz Championship on Wall Street in New York. He confirmed this development via text message and plans to fly to New York later tonight.

  • Arjun's participation is vital for his standing in the FIDE Circuit, where he is currently trailing Fabiano Caruana by six points.
  • The upcoming tournament offers significant points for the FIDE Circuit 2024 race, crucial for the Candidates tournament qualification.
  • Arjun currently holds 124.40 points, while Caruana leads with 132.42 points after winning the Saint Louis Masters.
  • The championship will be held from December 26 to 31, featuring top players like Magnus Carlsen and Hikaru Nakamura.
“The World Rapid and Blitz Championship may not be a classical world championship but it’s still a World Championship. It’s very prestigious. Besides, if I do well there I will have the chance to qualify for the Candidates tournament.” - Arjun Erigaisi

In conclusion, securing the visa allows Arjun to focus on his preparation for a crucial stage in his chess career, aiming for a spot in the prestigious Candidates tournament.
newTitle: Arjun Erigaisi Secures US Visa for World Rapid and Blitz Championship

title: Pat Cummins story: The Aussie in habit of turning lemons into lemonade - The Indian Express
summary:
The Journey of Pat Cummins: Turning Challenges into Success

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Indian Express

Pat Cummins, Australian cricket captain, has faced numerous challenges throughout his career, from injuries to personal crises, but he has consistently turned these adversities into opportunities for growth and success.

  • Cummins experienced a heartfelt moment before the 2021 Ashes, contemplating his newborn son.
  • As a child, he suffered a finger injury that affected his bowling style but did not deter his passion for cricket.
  • After a promising debut, Cummins faced injuries that caused him to restructure his approach to the game with mentoring from legends.
  • His experiences include a significant weight loss episode during a Bangladesh tour, which motivated him to prioritize fitness.
  • During the COVID-19 pandemic, he dealt with his mother's cancer diagnosis, leading to personal growth and reflection.
  • He faced public criticism over his environmental stance as a captain, which led to him founding 'Cricket for Climate'.
“I learned a few things about the impermanence of life and the importance of each day.” - Pat Cummins

Overall, Cummins exemplifies resilience, utilizing every crisis as a stepping stone for personal and professional development in his cricketing journey.
newTitle: The Journey of Pat Cummins: Turning Challenges into Success
